pullRequest.body:
feat: Monoidal and cartesian distributive categories

This PR defines monoidal and cartesian distributive categories, develop the API, and prove some main results. We show a closed monoidal category is distributive.

We also show that, for a category `C` with binary coproducts, the category of endofunctors `C тед C`  is left distributive. This requires the following new file which develops a convenient API for the binary (co)products in the functor categories:
CategoryTheory/Limits/FunctorCategory/Shapes/BinaryProducts

In Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Distributive/Cartesian.lean we show that the coproduct coprojections are monic in a cartesian distributive category. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [cf45c32fe1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20182/commits/cf45c32fe151d66fa9a790624344c73d8f3745a4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FunctorCategory.Shapes.BinaryProducts` (new file)|415|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Distributive.Monoidal` (new file)|464|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Distributive.Cartesian` (new file)|598|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CartesianDistribuitve`
`+ IsMonoidalDistrib`
`+ IsMonoidalLeftDistrib`
`+ IsMonoidalLeftDistrib.of_isIso_coprodComparisonTensorLeft`
`+ IsMonoidalLeftDistrib.preserves_binary_coproducts_tensorLeft`
`+ IsMonoidalRightDistrib`
`+ IsMonoidalRightDistrib.isIso_rightDistrib_hom`
`+ IsMonoidalRightDistrib.of_isIso_coprodComparisonTensorRight`
`+ IsMonoidalRightDistrib.preservesColimit_pair_tensorRight`
`+ IsMonoidalRightDistrib.preserves_binary_coproducts_tensorRight`
`+ MonoidalClosed.isMonoidalLeftDistrib`
`+ MonoidalClosed.leftDistrib_inv`
`+ SymmetricCategory.isMonoidalDistrib_of_isMonoidalLeftDistrib`
`+ SymmetricCategory.isMonoidalRightDistrib_of_isMonoidalLeftDistrib`
`+ SymmetricCategory.leftDistrib_braiding`
`+ SymmetricCategory.rightDistrib_braiding`
`+ SymmetricCategory.rightDistrib_of_leftDistrib`
`+ coprodObjIso`
`+ coprodObjIso_hom_cogap`
`+ coprodObjIso_hom_comp_coprod_inl`
`+ coprodObjIso_hom_comp_coprod_inr`
`+ coprodObjIso_hom_naturality`
`+ coprodObjIso_inv_comp_coprod_inl`
`+ coprodObjIso_inv_comp_coprod_inr`
`+ coprodObjIso_inv_naturality`
`+ coprod_inl_leftDistrib`
`+ coprod_inl_rightDistrib_hom`
`+ coprod_inr_leftDistrib`
`+ coprod_inr_rightDistrib_hom`
`+ instance [CartesianDistribuitve C] : IsMonoidalDistrib C := by infer_instance`
`+ instance [IsMonoidalLeftDistrib C] : MonoCoprod C`
`+ isIso_coprodComparison_tensorLeft_of_endofunctors`
`+ isMonoidalLeftDistrib_of_endofunctors`
`+ leftDistrib`
`+ leftDistrib_hom`
`+ monoidalOfChosenFiniteProducts.`

`+ piObjIso_inv_comp_prod_snd`

`+ prodObjIso_hom_naturality`
`+ prodObjIso_inv_naturality`
`+ rightDistrib`
`+ rightDistrib_hom`
`+ tensorLeftIsoTensorRight`
`+ whiskerLeft_coprod_inl_leftDistrib_inv`
`+ whiskerLeft_coprod_inr_leftDistrib_inv`
`+ whiskerRight_coprod_inl_rightDistrib_inv`
`+ whiskerRight_coprod_inr_rightDistrib_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I think this would be a better design:
```suggestion
class IsMonoidalLeftDistributive : Prop where
  preservesBinaryCoproducts_tensorLeft (X : C) : 
    PreservesColimitsOfShape (Discrete WalkingPair) (tensorLeft X)
```
Can you elaborate? is it because `PreservesLimitsOfShape` gives better automatic instance inference or some other reason?

By the way in few places, e.g. in `Distributive.Cartesian` the instance which proves `MonoCoprod C` from `MonoidalLeftDistributive C`, I explicitly use the distributor isomorphisms `тИВL`. Going with your suggestion, one thing we can do is to explicitly prove the invertibility of `тИВL` from preservation of coproducts. Would that be a good API?

We have a reasonably good API for the preservation of limits and colimits: we should use it, and improve it if this is necessary. One of the good reasons to use this approach is that in the closed monoidal case, we immediately get the preservations of binary coproducts from the fact `tensorLeft` is a left adjoint. I would suggest defining `тИВL` as an isomorphism (using `PreservesColimitPair.iso`) under the assumption `MonoidalLeftDistributive`.

Great! Just made changes to implement this idea. In particular `тИВL` is now defined as an isomorphism form `PreservesColimitPair.iso`. And the proof of of `IsMonoidalLeftDistrib` from `MonoidalClosed` uses `(ihom.adjunction X).leftAdjoint_preservesColimits`.
An entry should be added in `docs/references.bib`.

The universe parameter of `MonoidalCategory` can be inferred from the category structure:
```suggestion
    [MonoidalCategory C] [HasBinaryCoproducts C] : Prop where
```

This is unnecessary as it can be inferred automatically from the previous instance.
```suggestion
```

`Iso.isIso_hom` is already an instance:
```suggestion
```
You are actually proving a more general (useful) lemma `preservesBinaryCoproducts_of_isIso_coprodComparison`, which should be added to `Limits.Preserves.Shapes.BinaryProducts`.

```suggestion
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma coprod_inl_leftDistrib_hom {X Y Z : C} :
    coprod.inl тЙл (тИВL X Y Z).hom = X тЧБ coprod.inl := by
```
Same below.
I'm not sure about this, since `simp` can prove it. Adding `simp` gives linter error, I believe.

```suggestion
lemma whiskerLeft_coprod_inl_leftDistrib_inv {X Y Z : C} :
```

This must not be a simp lemma:
```suggestion
```

"Braided" is sufficient:
```suggestion
lemma SymmetricCategory.leftDistrib_braiding [BraidedCategory C] {X Y Z : C} :
```

The definition `SymmetricCategory.tensorLeftIsoTensorRight` should be generalized to `BraidedCategory.tensorLeftIsoTensorRight`:
```lean
/-- In a braided monoidal category, the functors `tensorLeft X` and
`tensorRight X` are isomorphic. -/
@[simps]
def BraidedCategory.tensorLeftIsoTensorRight {C : Type u} [Category.{v} C]
    [MonoidalCategory C] [BraidedCategory C] (X : C) :
    tensorLeft X тЙЕ tensorRight X where
  hom := { app Y := (╬▓_ X Y).hom }
  inv := { app Y := (╬▓_ X Y).inv }
```

```suggestion
  preservesBinaryCoproducts_tensorLeft X := by
    have := (ihom.adjunction X).isLeftAdjoint
    infer_instance
```
It would be useful to add `IsLeftAdjoint` instances for closed monoidal categories, so that the line with `have := ...` would become unnecessary.
You should put the results about endofunctors in a section.
done.

If you import `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.FunctorCategory`, the previous lemma (and the file `FunctorCategoryShapes/BinaryProducts`) becomes unnecessary:
```suggestion
instance isMonoidalLeftDistrib_of_endofunctors : IsMonoidalLeftDistrib (C тед C) where
  preservesBinaryCoproducts_tensorLeft F :=
    inferInstanceAs (PreservesColimitsOfShape _ ((whiskeringLeft C C C).obj F))
```

I am not expert with notations, but with this, `тИВL` would be accessible anywhere where `CategoryTheory` is opened. It seems you should do :
```lean
namespace Distributive

scoped notation "тИВL" => leftDistrib

end Distributive

open Distributive
```
did the same for `тИВR`.

```suggestion
```
I am unsure about this being an instance. I feel it is safer to make it only a lemma, not an instance. (The proof of the previous lemma should be inserted as a field here.)

```suggestion
  aesop_cat
```
`aesop_cat` is a powerful tactic in category theory. (Otherwise, `ext <;> simp` would be ok also.)
We have `MonoidalPreadditive`, which should imply the expected conditions.
